newsitem.title: NORWAY: AKER MARITIME JUMPS 9 PCT ON POSITIVE H1.
newsitem.headline: AKER MARITIME JUMPS 9 PCT ON POSITIVE H1.

text.p: Shares in Norwegian offshore supply company Aker Maritime ASA jumped more than nine percent on Thursday after the group presented better than expected results for the first half 1997.
At 0930 GMT, Aker Maritime stood at a high so far at 130 crowns, a rise of 11 crowns or 9.24 percent. Turnover in the company was 12 million crowns.

Aker Maritime posted a 23 percent rise in first-half revenues to 6.06 billion crowns compared with 4.94 billion in the same 1996 period due to higher activity in operations and the acquisition of new companies.

However, a 120 million crown provision in the second quarter resulting from a dispute with Norsk Hydro ASA over the Njord oil platform, reduced half-year operating profits by more than a third to 96 million crowns against 151 million crowns.
